授業目的: The purpose of this course is to introduce 1st year students to the origins and historical development of Christianity, its presence in the world today, the Bible, and some Christian theology and language and expressions of Christian faith. Students will also learn about Christianity's influence on societies and social justice movements past and present and be exposed to the spirit and ideals for establishing Kwansei Gakuin and its history. Kwansei Gakuin University is a Christian university, founded in 1889 by Rev. Walter Russell Lambuth, a missionary of the Southern Methodist Episcopal Church in the United States. Ever since its founding, Kwansei Gakuin University has educated its students based on the principles of Christianity. The Christiantiy A&B introductory courses have been important parts of our education.
到達目標:
1.    to become knowledgeable about the origin and historical development of Christianity;

2.    to become knowledgeable about some Christian foundations – beliefs, practices, values and ethics;

3.    to become knowledgeable about Christianity’s presence and influence in today’s world and some ministries;

4.    to become knowledgeable about the spirit and ideals of Kwansei Gakuin for student life present and in the future.
授業方法: In-person lectures, readings, writings, discussions, and presentations, with two guest speakers (Zoom or in-person)
